title: video tag having issues playing the video continuously
body: **Do you want to request a *feature* or report a *bug*?** No **What is the current behavior?** I am running drag and drop control and you can setup the property of the particular control So, the structure looks something like this **left side** Controls **center** draggable area **right side** properties of the control So, in the controls I am having one video tag and then i am dragging into the draggable area, So everything works fine till now. Once I have the video control inside the draggable area I have one checkbox in the properties area named `autoplay` once I check it the video plays automatically. here is my code, ``` return this.props.changeActiveElement(this.props.uniqueId, this.props.stylesToApply)} onDoubleClick={this.props.OpenDefaultEvent} dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{ __html: this.props.htmlToAdd }} > ``` **If the current behavior is a bug, please provide the steps to reproduce and if possible a minimal demo of the problem. Your bug will get fixed much faster if we can run your code and it doesn't have dependencies other than React. Paste the link to your JSFiddle (https://jsfiddle.net/Luktwrdm/) or CodeSandbox (https://codesandbox.io/s/new) example below:** **What is the expected behavior?** It should not rerender the whole video it should only change the property. Once I have the property changed it rerenders the whole video and starts again. If I use any third party html parser then video doesn't restart but it is not playing too. **Which versions of React, and which browser / OS are affected by this issue? Did this work in previous versions of React?** 16.3.1 Chrome latest version
